clinical_study.brief_title: Infants of Diabetic Mothers: A Cohort Study
clinical_study.official_title: Study of Outcome of Infants of Diabetic Mothers in a Tertiary Hospital Set up

brief_summary.textblock: Saudi Arabia has been named by the International Diabetes Federation as among the top ten countries with highest prevalence of diabetes. Women are said to have overall prevalence twice that for men. With high birth rate in the country we decided to look at the impact of diabetic pregnancies on their off-springs

detailed_description.textblock:
Diabetics are followed regularly in diabetic outpatient clinics where dietary and medical management are offered. Diabetic pregnancies are managed by a team consisting of diabetologist, obstetrician, feto-maternal obstetrician and dietician.
Management of these pregnancies depends on whether these women have pre-gestational or gestational diabetes. Very few diabetic women have exposure to preconceptual advice. For this reason we opted to find out the outcome of infants of diabetic mothers compared to those mothers who are essentially normal with no associated medical or obstetric disorders. Equally we wanted to see if there are differences in the outcome of infants born to pre-gestational and gestational diabetic mothers.

primary_outcome.time_frame: At time of first clinical examination
primary_outcome.description: Assess presence of congenital malformations in infants of diabetic mothers

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Until discharge from hospital or death
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the length of hospital stay for infants of diabetic mothers

other_outcome.description: To assess incidence of preterm birth in infants of diabetic mothers

other_outcome.measure: Admission to neonatal intensive care unit
other_outcome.description: To assess the need of infants of diabetic mothers for admission to neonatal intensive care

intervention.intervention_name: Prevention of complications in infants of diabetic mothers
intervention.description: strict glycemic control in diabetic pregnancies

study_pop.textblock: All Infants of diabetic mothers born at security Forces Hospital, Riyadh

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:All infants born to diabetic mothers
- Infants born to mothers with normal pregnancies
Exclusion Criteria:
- Infants born to mothers with other medical disorders before or during pregnancy which may affect the newborn
